result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Equarius D Adams-Johnson

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 11 FOR BRANCH 40:
Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Equarius D Adams-Johnson.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case remains calendared in Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz appeared by video for Equarius D Adams-Johnson.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rest. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 40. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.

Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Equarius D Adams-Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Rebholz has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Equarius D Adams-Johnson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Equarius D Adams-Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
